    Classification Regression

    Plot PCA

    plot_PCA.Rd

    Plot PCA

    Usage

    plot_PCA(
  PCA,
  groups,
  title = "",
  grid.arrange.ncol = 1,
  palette = NULL,
  palette.type = "qual",
  order = NULL,
  width = NULL,
  height = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    PCA

    object as returned by prcomp

    groups

    data frame containing the groups (each column is a different group)

    title

    plot title

    grid.arrange.ncol

    number of columns to arrange plots in final figure

    palette

    (optional) when a single value, if a string, it is considered as a name of palette; if a number, it is the index into the lists of palettes of appropriate type. If palette is a single (unnamed) value, will be used for all the groups. If is a named vector, each element matching a column in groups will be used. The parameter is passed to scale_colour_brewer

    palette.type

    palette type. One of seq (sequential), div (diverging) or qual (qualitative)

    order

    the order to force before arranging the list of plots in the grid. If order is set to order = 'auto' and grid.arrange.ncol=2, the resulting grid has PC components from same group across the columns, while the same PC components for different groups are reported across the rows

    width, height

    size of each plot in inches

    ...

    further arguments to arrangeGrob

    Value

    a ggplot2 object

    Author

    Alessandro Barberis

    On this page

    Developed by Alessandro Barberis, Francesca Buffa.
